title: Woman violently sexually assaulted by man who held knife to her throat in alleyway near Trafford Hospital
text:
Woman violently sexually assaulted by man who held knife to her throat in alleyway near Trafford Hospital "I understand this will cause concern in the community and we have increased patrols in the area." A woman was violently sexually assaulted near Trafford General Hospital by a man who pinned her to the ground and held a knife to her throat. 
The terrifying attack happened on Monday night in the alleyway which runs alongside the hospital between Moorside Road and Davyhulme Road. 
Police say the victim, who is in her 40s, was walking through the alleyway at around 5.45pm when she was hit hard across the back of the head and fell to the floor. 
She was then pinned down by her attacker who held a knife to her throat before sexually assaulting her. 
The man was disturbed by something and fled the scene. 
He is white, in his late 20s, about 6ft 2ins, with light ginger or blond eyebrows, and had a Manchester accent. Read More 
The suspect is also believed to have been wearing a grey hooded top that was pulled tight around his face to his eyebrows and bottom lip, and grey jogging bottoms that were a different shade to his top. Trafford General Hospital 
Witnesses say the alleyway was cordoned off at both ends for several hours last night. 
Detective Inspector John Stainton, from GMP’s Trafford borough, said the victim is being supported by specially trained officers. 
He also confirmed patrols have been increased in the area. 
“This was a terrifying attack on an innocent woman who was going about her day as usual. Everyone has the right to go about their daily lives without fear of being attacked or sexually assaulted. Read More Drunk bus passenger jailed over 'vile and disgusting' racist abuse shared on Facebook 
“Specially trained officers are currently supporting her and I would like to praise her for her courage in reporting this to us. I understand this will cause concern in the community and we have increased patrols in the area. 
“A team of officers have been working non-stop to find the man responsible and we will continue with our efforts. 
“If you saw a man acting suspiciously in the area around the time of the offence then please call police. If you recognise the description of the man then I would also urge you to contact us.” 
If you have any concerns at all or want to speak to someone to pass on information or report a sexual offence you can contact police on 101 or the independent charity Crimestoppers, anonymously on 0800 555 111.” Like us on Facebook
